page.title: 09Male Employment(Harold Hill)
page.content: We did a survey of 100 families with children to find out the jobs that the men did.We found that 29 people in our survey were drivers of some sort-lorries,ice-cream vans,taxis etc.There were 14 people woking in factories making anything from curtains to cars.Only two of these worked in Fords at Dagenham making cars,although at one time a lot of people in this area worked there.Twenty-one people did jobs connected with the building trade,such as tilers,brick-layers etc.The rest of the men had the following-8 worked in an office,7 worked in shops,3 on buses or trains,2 were gardeners,2 electricians,1 was a manager of a snooker club and 1 worked at the British Museum.Twelve men were out of work because they had been made redundant.
